node.name: exc_07_10C
node.code:
library(patchwork)
g1 <- ggplot(BudgetFood, 
             aes(factor(size), wfood, color = sex)) +
  geom_boxplot() 

g2 <- ggplot(BudgetFood, 
             aes(factor(size), totexp, color = sex)) +
  geom_boxplot() + 
  scale_y_log10()

g1 / g2 + plot_layout(guides = "collect")

node.name: solution_01_03
node.code:
options(tidyverse.quiet = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)

mtcars <- mtcars %>%
  mutate(am = factor(am, levels = 0:1, labels = c("Automatic", "Manual")))


# Print the gear variable of mtcars
mtcars$gear

# Assign the number of rows in mtcars to `n`
n <- nrow(mtcars)

# Uncomment this to see the plot
# ggplot(mtcars, aes(am, mpg)) + geom_violin()

node.code:
library(ggplot2)
library(Ecdat)
ggplot(data = BudgetFood, 
       mapping = aes(x = totexp)) +
  geom_histogram(aes(y = after_stat(density))) +
  geom_density(color = "red")

node.name: solution_07_06B
node.code:
library(ggplot2)
library(Ecdat)
ggplot(data = subset(BudgetFood, !is.na(sex)), 
       mapping = aes(x = sex,
                     y = age)) +
  geom_violin(aes(fill = sex)) +
  geom_boxplot(width = 0.1)

node.name: solution_07_06C
node.code:
library(ggplot2)
library(Ecdat)
ggplot(data = subset(BudgetFood, size < 30), 
       mapping = aes(x = size,
                     y = totexp)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(color = "red",
                  method = loess,
                  formula = y ~ x)

node.name: solution_07_06D
node.code:
library(ggplot2)
library(Ecdat)
ggplot(data = subset(BudgetFood, !is.na(sex)), 
       mapping = aes(x = sex)) +
  geom_bar() +
  geom_text(aes(label = after_stat(count)),
                 vjust = -0.3,
                 stat = "count")

node.name: solution_07_06E
node.code:
library(tidyverse)
library(Ecdat)
dat <- BudgetFood %>% 
  filter(!is.na(sex)) %>% 
  group_by(town, sex) %>% 
  summarise(totexp = mean(totexp))

ggplot() +
  geom_col(data = subset(dat, sex=="woman"),
               aes(x = factor(town),
                   y = totexp,
                  fill = "woman")) +
  geom_col(data = subset(dat, sex=="man"),
               aes(x = factor(town),
                   y = -totexp,
                  fill = "man"))

node.name: solution_07_10A
node.code:
ggplot(BudgetFood, aes(x = age)) + 
  geom_histogram(data = select(BudgetFood, -town),
                 fill = "grey", binwidth = 1,
                 aes(y = after_stat(density))) +
  geom_histogram(aes(y = after_stat(density)),
                 binwidth = 1) +
  geom_density(color = "red") +
  facet_wrap(~town)

node.name: solution_07_10B
node.code:
ggplot(subset(BudgetFood, !is.na(sex)), aes(age)) +
  geom_histogram(aes(y = after_stat(density))) +
  geom_text(x = 35, y = 0.035, 
            data = function(.data) .data %>% 
              group_by(sex, town) %>% 
              count(),
            aes(label = n)) +
  facet_grid(sex ~ town)

node.name: solution_07_10C
node.code:
library(patchwork)
g1 <- ggplot(BudgetFood, 
             aes(factor(size), wfood, color = sex)) +
  geom_boxplot() 

g2 <- ggplot(BudgetFood, 
             aes(factor(size), totexp, color = sex)) +
  geom_boxplot() + 
  scale_y_log10()

g1 / g2 + plot_layout(guides = "collect")
